programmes.show_description: 5/6. Nina has a moment of clarity at the museum fundraiser, which changes everything. Contains some strong language and adult humour.
6/6. Nina wants to make things right, but a family emergency means she has to drop everything. Contains some strong language and adult humour.
Detailed weather forecast.
BBC One joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news.
The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.
Join Gethin Jones, Helen Skelton, Michelle Ackerley and the team for conversation, advice and tips to make your day that little bit easier.
14/15. The dangers of nicotine pouches and patches, mixing lemon juice and coffee for supposed health benefits, and the rise of bootleg weight-loss jabs.
A firefighter is on hand to try to save a Somerset terrace.
Eric Knowles is in Cheshire with experts Charles Hanson and Caroline Hawley, and the teams. Eric visits a unique collection of over 700 cuckoo clocks.

programmes.show_name: BBC News at One including BBC Newsline
programmes.show_description: The latest national and international news from the BBC.
Married couple Trish and Byron are falling out over how to parent their blended family. With seven children, and a 22-year age gap between the two of them, solving it won't be easy.
12/15. Herbes de Provence is famous. But with no UK equivalent, Marcus wants to create his own simple dried herb mix to rival this French classic and turn any dull dish into a tasty meal.
16/55. Wanting to escape south London, a mother and son meet up with Sonali Shah in the Lothians, where they want to find their ideal rural retreat, complete with an art studio.
9/20. Mark Wright, Tommy Walsh and Maxine Dwyer help Mia reclaim her chaotic home and create the perfect therapy room.
14/15. Izzie risks porcelain déjà vu, and Mark finds a cherubic figurine with potential as we play hide-and-seek in Kent. But the auction is coming, ready or not!
49/55. The quiz in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of.
The latest national and international news from the BBC.
Local news from across Northern Ireland with Tara Mills and Declan Harvey.
Alex Jones and Roman Kemp bring you the stories that matter from across the country.
A bad situation looks set to get much worse for Ravi. Patrick and Yolande are shocked by Denzel. And Penny lets her guard down with Vinny.
5/14. Co-founder and CEO of Refy Beauty, Jenna Meek, returns to the Den.
5/12. The candidates turn petals into profits, selling flowers to the public and corporate clients. But a bunch of problems lead to a pruning in the boardroom.
The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.
Local news from across Northern Ireland with Tara Mills and Declan Harvey.
Mark Carruthers and guests provide comment and expert analysis on political news.
Fiona Bruce presents an hour of debate from Birmingham. On the panel, Lisa Nandy MP, Alicia Kearns MP, Jess Brown-Fuller MP, Tom Kerridge and Esther Krakue.
Lighthearted discussion of the week's political events.
8/11. Rob Brydon hosts the award-winning comedy panel show. Lee Mack and David Mitchell are joined by guest panellists Jonathan Ross, Kate Garraway, JB Gill and Michelle Wolf.

15/15. How to fall safely, the pros and cons of milk alternatives, and how a private ADHD diagnosis doesn't guarantee access to the necessary medications on the NHS.
Jacqui is stopped in her tracks by a huge hole in the floor of a former restaurant in Westcott in Surrey.
Take your seat as the curtain opens on a special episode to celebrate 50 years of British theatre's coveted awards.

6/10. Father Brown investigates when Violet Goodfellow is attacked by the killer of a senior policeman.
